head.title: Mullin and Nets Don't Seem a Fit

identified-content.classifier: Top/News/Sports/Pro Basketball/National Basketball Association/New Jersey Nets

hedline.hl1: Mullin and Nets Don't Seem a Fit

abstract.p: New Jersey Nets will not be signing free agent Chris Mullin (S)

block.p: The Nets will not be signing the free agent Chris Mullin, the 37-year-old small forward and former St. John's star from Brooklyn whom the Indiana Pacers chose not to re-sign.

Since the Nets re-signed the veteran Johnny Newman this summer, there is not much room for Mullin as a perimeter player. Even if New Jersey would have gambled on Mullin, he would have been limited in his playing time, much as he was in Indiana this past season.
The Nets will not be signing the free agent Chris Mullin, the 37-year-old small forward and former St. John's star from Brooklyn whom the Indiana Pacers chose not to re-sign.

Since the Nets re-signed the veteran Johnny Newman this summer, there is not much room for Mullin as a perimeter player. Even if New Jersey would have gambled on Mullin, he would have been limited in his playing time, much as he was in Indiana this past season.
Chris is looking at a team where he can get minutes, and where he can win and win big, Nets President Rod Thorn said yesterday.

Thorn also said the Nets were not likely to be re-signing the free agent Scott Burrell, a 6-foot-7-inch forward who averaged 6.1 points and 3.5 rebounds a game last season coming off the bench. ''He's looking for as much guarantee of playing time that somebody else might be able to give him,'' Thorn said.
The Nets begin training camp Oct. 3 in their own facility in East Rutherford and Thorn hopes to have just 18 players in camp.
